definition: to emit/to give off/to send out (or up, forth)/to brave/to face/reckless/to falsely adopt (sb's identity etc)/to feign/(literary) to cover

sentences.english: Only those who never take any risks never fail.
sentences.chinese: 只有從不冒風險的人才永遠不會失敗。

sentences.english: The Hungarian chess player decided not to take risks and did not play for the win.
sentences.chinese: 匈牙利選手決定不冒風險準備接受和局。

sentences.english: The risk is as nothing compared to the gain.
sentences.chinese: 所冒風險與所得相比不足掛齒。

sentences.english: It was another of those risks worth taking.
sentences.chinese: 這是另一件值得冒風險去做的事。

sentences.english: It is unwise to expose yourself by trying to do something that is too difficult for you.
sentences.chinese: 企圖做你力不能及之事而冒風險，是不明智的。

sentences.english: It is hazardous, though, to credit threading for these accelerations.
sentences.chinese: 但是，相信線程化會帶來這些加速是要冒風險的。

sentences.english: We forgot there is no such thing as a risk-free conflict.
sentences.chinese: 我們忘記了沒有哪次衝突是不冒風險的。

sentences.english: Those who take risks often reap great rewards.
They would rather to take risks tbr their ideal.
sentences.chinese: 他們寧願冒風險載重他們的理想。

sentences.english: And certainly if you are going to build great edifices, you probably do have to take risk.
sentences.chinese: 當然如果你要建築偉業的話，就必須要冒風險。
